quest.name: With Great Fortune Comes Great Responsibility
journal:
The Far Eastern omikujishi appears troubled by what he is seeing.

※This quest is available for a limited time only.

Concerned by the Far Eastern omikujishi's worried expression, you approach him once more to discover what may have caused the furrow in his brow. Before you can say a word, however, he asks for a moment of your time, nodding in Beaudefoin's direction. His desire to lift the adventurer's spirits is quickly apparent, and though he makes a valiant effort to do so, the despondent man can no longer see reason. Convinced that his words cannot reach the down-on-his-luck adventurer, the omikujishi instead turns to you, asking that you too make an attempt to cheer the poor man up.

※Please note that you will be unable to complete this quest after the seasonal event has ended. For details, please check the Lodestone.

Despite your best efforts to rally Beaudefoin's spirits, it is to no avail. The omikujishi refuses to give up on the crestfallen man, however, and asks that you try to reach him once more with a different approach.

Seeing that your second attempt to rouse Beaudefoin is unfruitful, the omikujishi bids him recite the contents of the fortune, only to discover the dejected man had never read the whole thing. And yet, upon reading it, Beaudefoin somehow manages to sink even further into the depths of despair. The omikujishi, having at last lost patience, reads the remainder of the fortune himself. The fortune's final words of guidance, and a well-placed remark from yourself are what finally release Beaudefoin from the clutches of his own fear. But no sooner has he been made to see reason than the mochi daikan appears before you out of breath, bringing distressing news of an adventurer in trouble. Believing this adventurer to be Hildelana, Beaudefoin rushes off to the rescue. Concerned whether Beaudefoin is in the right state of mind to be saving anyone, the omikujishi asks that you follow after him, to which you oblige.

Though you find Hildelana and Beaudefoin free from any serious harm, the same cannot be said for Beaudefoin's beloved armor. The adventurer pair set off to visit the armorer and promise to find you again later. The mochi daikan suggests that you both return to Limsa Lominsa, and report the current state of affairs to the omikujishi.

Just as you finish reciting the tale of Beaudefoin and Hildelana's rescue to the omikujishi, the pair return as promised. Having heard that naught can be done for Beaudefoin's armor, and moved by his selfless act, the usagi bugyo insists that the adventurer accept a set of yoroi from the Far Eastern delegation. The omikujishi reminds the flabbergasted man, still unable to believe his luck, that omikuji should be seen as a guide, and not as one's fate set in stone. With a new set of armor in tow, Beaudefoin and Hildelana are ready to set off on a new adventure, their bond of friendship tempered by the day's events. Turning to you, the omikujishi thanks you for your service, offering you a set of yoroi of your own, and the opportunity to draw as many omikuji as you wish. With your obligations thus fulfilled, you are free to enjoy the remainder of the festivities to your heart's content.
objectives: Search for Beaudefoin in lower La Noscea.
Speak with the Far Eastern omikujishi in Limsa Lominsa.

dialogue.name: HILDELANA
dialogue.text: Goodness, I can't believe I'd never heard of omikuji before this!

dialogue.name: BEAUDEFOIN
dialogue.text: Ugh, what am I supposed to do now...?

dialogue.name: OMIKUJISHI
dialogue.text: Forgive me, my friend, but might I ask for another moment of your time?

dialogue.name: OMIKUJISHI
dialogue.text: In no small part due to your assistance, many are enjoying their first experience with omikuji. For some, however, it appears to be a source of stress...

dialogue.name: OMIKUJISHI
dialogue.text: These two adventurers, for example, drew opposite results...

dialogue.name: HILDELANA
dialogue.text: “Great fortune,” it says! Can you believe it!? That means I have naught to fear... Aye, this is my chance to make it big as an adventurer!

dialogue.name: BEAUDEFOIN
dialogue.text: Seven hells, what a dreadful Heavensturn this turned out to be... “Grave misfortune”? What did I do to deserve such rotten luck?

dialogue.name: OMIKUJISHI
dialogue.text: Do not be so disheartened, my friend. Though omikuji may foretell fortune and misfortune, they also provide us with guidance in our daily lives.

dialogue.name: OMIKUJISHI
dialogue.text: A great blessing can become a curse should one view it as a license to act rashly. Similarly, a great curse can become a blessing should one heed its warning. What you make of your lot depends on you.

dialogue.name: BEAUDEFOIN
dialogue.text: So you say...but just look at Hildelana. At how happy she is. Why can't I be like that...

dialogue.name: OMIKUJISHI
dialogue.text: My words failed to reach him, alas, but perhaps yours can. Could you try to rally his spirits?

dialogue.name: OMIKUJISHI
dialogue.text: I cannot bear to see the poor man this way. Please, try to rally his spirits.

dialogue.name: BEAUDEFOIN
dialogue.text: Ah, woe is me! What am I to do when misfortune awaits me at every turn?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Beaudefoin is crestfallen. Perhaps there is something you can do to rally his spirits.

dialogue.name: BEAUDEFOIN
dialogue.text: Ah, woe is me! What am I to do when misfortune awaits me at every turn?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Beaudefoin is crestfallen. Perhaps there is something you can do to rally his spirits.

dialogue.name: BEAUDEFOIN
dialogue.text: Thank you for trying to cheer me up. I appreciate it, truly. But you do not understand the burden I bear. The burden of “grave misfortune” that weighs heavily upon my soul...

dialogue.name: OMIKUJISHI
dialogue.text: This is rather more serious than I thought... Please, can you think of any other ways to lift him out of his malaise?

dialogue.name: OMIKUJISHI
dialogue.text: The man seems convinced that he is hopelessly cursed, which is not at all the case. Please, try to lift him out of his malaise.

dialogue.name: BEAUDEFOIN
dialogue.text: <sigh> Fate is a cruel mistress...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Beaudefoin remains downcast. As a fellow adventurer, perhaps you have the capacity to psych him up.

dialogue.name: BEAUDEFOIN
dialogue.text: <sigh> Fate is a cruel mistress...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Beaudefoin remains downcast. As a fellow adventurer, perhaps you have the capacity to psych him up.

dialogue.name: BEAUDEFOIN
dialogue.text: Y-You're right. I mustn't give up the fight. And yet...

dialogue.name: OMIKUJISHI
dialogue.text: Do you feel better, my friend?

dialogue.name: OMIKUJISHI
dialogue.text: I see... If I may, what did the omikuji say in its entirety? As I mentioned, they do not only foretell one's fate, but also provide guidance in one's daily life.

dialogue.name: BEAUDEFOIN
dialogue.text: I must confess, I didn't see anything beyond the words “grave misfortune,” so shocked I was. I ought to have a proper read, I suppose. Let's see here...

dialogue.name: BEAUDEFOIN
dialogue.text: “Adventure: Thou must think of others before thyself.” Well, that isn't so bad. And next...“Prosperity: Prepare to lose thy treasured armor”...

dialogue.name: BEAUDEFOIN
dialogue.text: <whimper> I knew I shouldn't have read the blasted thing... This set of armor is my pride and joy─I worked myself to the bone earning the gil to pay for it. And now I'm going to lose it all...

dialogue.name: OMIKUJISHI
dialogue.text: Come now, let us read the omikuji to the end!

dialogue.name: OMIKUJISHI
dialogue.text: Look: “As the Navigator maintaineth Her net, so too must thou tend to thy friendships. Let not camaraderie's weave fall into disrepair.” ...Sage advice, would you not agree?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Treasure your comrades, and your luck may change for the better.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: What matters is how you choose to act.

dialogue.name: BEAUDEFOIN
dialogue.text: Yes... Yes, you are right. My thanks to the two of you for helping me to see sense.

dialogue.name: MOCHIDAIKAN
dialogue.text: Help! I need help! <pant>

dialogue.name: OMIKUJISHI
dialogue.text: Mochi daikan! Calm down and tell us what ails you.

dialogue.name: MOCHIDAIKAN
dialogue.text: I-I was preparing for the mochi pounding when a young adventurer, cheerful and fearless, emerged from the city...

dialogue.name: MOCHIDAIKAN
dialogue.text: At first I didn't pay her much mind...but then to my horror, she ran afoul of a group of enormous fiends! The monstrosities overwhelmed her in mere moments, and I rushed here as quickly as I could for help.

dialogue.name: OMIKUJISHI
dialogue.text: A cheerful and fearless young adventurer? Kami preserve, could it be Hildelana!?

dialogue.name: BEAUDEFOIN
dialogue.text: What!? But...how can this be? She was supposed to have “great fortune”!

dialogue.name: BEAUDEFOIN
dialogue.text: Ugh, but this isn't the time for such questions... I must go to her aid!

dialogue.name: OMIKUJISHI
dialogue.text: Beaudefoin, wait!

dialogue.name: OMIKUJISHI
dialogue.text: This is a troubling situation...

dialogue.name: OMIKUJISHI
dialogue.text: You strike me as an adventurer of considerable prowess. Will you not go after Beaudefoin and lend your aid if necessary?

dialogue.name: MOCHIDAIKAN
dialogue.text: Our thanks! Please follow me!

dialogue.name: OMIKUJISHI
dialogue.text: As much as I wish to help, I would only be a hindrance. Please see that both Hildelana and Beaudefoin are safe.

dialogue.name: HILDELANA
dialogue.text: You came too... Thank you...

dialogue.name: BEAUDEFOIN
dialogue.text: Followed me here, did you? We both took a bit of a beating, but I'm pleased to say we're still breathing.

dialogue.name: HILDELANA
dialogue.text: I finished the guild's request without issue, but then I got greedy. If Beaudefoin hadn't arrived when he did, who knows what might have happened...

dialogue.name: BEAUDEFOIN
dialogue.text: I merely did what any friend would, Hildelana. I'm just glad I made it in time.

dialogue.name: HILDELANA
dialogue.text: I shouldn't have put you through that. And look what's become of your armor... I'm so sorry, Beaudefoin. It's broken because of me...

dialogue.name: BEAUDEFOIN
dialogue.text: Oh, don't mention it. It's a small price for protecting a dear friend, and one I'd willingly pay again and again.

dialogue.name: BEAUDEFOIN
dialogue.text: Heh, but if this didn't play out exactly as the omikuji had foretold...

dialogue.name: BEAUDEFOIN
dialogue.text: Well, let's return to the city. For one, I need to pay the armorers a visit, but we'll look for you afterwards!

dialogue.name: MOCHIDAIKAN
dialogue.text: What a relief that neither of them came to lasting harm... Let us head back ourselves. The omikujishi will doubtless be eager to hear the tidings.

dialogue.name: MOCHIDAIKAN
dialogue.text: Ah, there you are. Hopefully Beaudefoin and Hildelana will join us as well.

dialogue.name: OMIKUJISHI
dialogue.text: Welcome back, my friend! I understand everyone is safe, but what happened out there?

dialogue.name: OMIKUJISHI
dialogue.text: My friends, I cannot well express how relieved I am for your preservation. It is because I failed to explain the omikuji in sufficient detail that you met with danger. I can't apologize enough...

dialogue.name: HILDELANA
dialogue.text: Please do not blame yourself. I'm the one who overestimated my own abilities. Having “great fortune” doesn't mean that one can act without due care, I realize this now.

dialogue.name: HILDELANA
dialogue.text: And I would have realized sooner had I properly read the omikuji beforehand. “Adventure: The way shall open to those who know their limits,” it says...

dialogue.name: HILDELANA
dialogue.text: But there's more. “Relationships: Thou shalt be blessed with stalwart comrades.” And I truly am.

dialogue.name: MOCHIDAIKAN
dialogue.text: Ah, that reminds me─what became of your armor? You wished to have it repaired, I believe.

dialogue.name: BEAUDEFOIN
dialogue.text: Unfortunately, it was too far gone. The armorer told me it would make more sense to have a new one crafted...not that I have that sort of coin either.

dialogue.name: RABBITMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: In that case, I believe we can be of service. We offer a set of yoroi─armor, in your tongue─as a reward to those who have helped to make this Heavensturn celebration better. You have more than earned it.

dialogue.name: BEAUDEFOIN
dialogue.text: Truly!? This sounds too good to be true...

dialogue.name: RABBITMISSIONARY
dialogue.text: Ah, but it is true, my friend, and no more than you deserve. Come now, don't be shy. Take your prize and try it on!

dialogue.name: BEAUDEFOIN
dialogue.text: It's magnificent! Just magnificent! Heh, and to think my omikuji said “grave misfortune”!

dialogue.name: OMIKUJISHI
dialogue.text: Take this as a lesson that, no matter your fortune, you still hold the power to shape your fate. And I believe the yoroi suits you well, if I might add.

dialogue.name: OMIKUJISHI
dialogue.text: As you will recall, your fortune cautioned you to put the needs of others before yourself. And so you did, by risking your life to save your comrade. That selfless act may well have reversed your “grave misfortune.”

dialogue.name: HILDELANA
dialogue.text: I see! ...Actually, I don't. I don't really understand the workings of omikuji, but I do know that I'll always have Beaudefoin's back, just as he's always had mine. And, now that he has a new set of armor, perhaps we can take to the road. Together.

dialogue.name: OMIKUJISHI
dialogue.text: I can't thank you enough for helping with the many unexpected troubles that occurred this day. I would be honored if you'd accept a set of yoroi of your own.

dialogue.name: OMIKUJISHI
dialogue.text: Furthermore, should you wish to draw omikuji, you need only say the word. Indeed, I hope to see you many more times before the festivities end!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You may now draw omikuji for the remainder of the Heavensturn festivities this year by speaking with the Far Eastern omikujishi.
